pages.title: Slag and Rockwool
pages.text: Slag is a mineral-rich substance produced by smelting gravel in an $(l:thermal:technology/machines/smelter)induction smelter$(/l). Rockwool is a fibrous material created by spinning molten mineral materials, such as slag, in a furnace. It is a flame-retardant, slightly more blast-resistant version of normal wool.
